PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: I ds = ( W / 2L ) × μ × C i ( V gs - V th ) The OFET device using as-cast PCDTBT films without thermal annealing exhibits a hole mobility of 2.2 × 10^-4 cm^2 / V°s with an on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) of 4.44 × 10^3 .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| W |
| L |
| μ |
| C |
| Vgs |
| Vth |
| I |
| Ion |
| Ioff |

Note:

* W, L, μ, C, Vgs, Vth, I, Ion, and Ioff are all property names mentioned in the paragraph.
* The symbols for these properties are commonly used in the field of electronics and semiconductors.
* The property names are presented in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| μ |
| C |
| Vgs |
| Vth |

Note:

* μ, C, Vgs, and Vth are material properties mentioned in the paragraph.
* W and L are not material properties, but rather dimensions and a variable, respectively.
* I and Ion/Ioff are not material properties, but rather electrical current and its ratio.
* The property names are presented in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: I ds = ( W / 2L ) × μ × C i ( V gs - V th ) The OFET device using as-cast PCDTBT films without thermal annealing exhibits a hole mobility of 2.2 × 10^-4 cm^2 / V°s with an on / off current ratio ( I on / I off ) of 4.44 × 10^3 .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| W | Width |
| L | Length |
| μ | Mobility |
| C | Capacitance |
| Vgs | Gate-source voltage |
| Vth | Threshold voltage |
| Ion | On-state current |
| Ioff | Off-state current |
| I | Current |

Note: The entities in the paragraph can be identified as follows:

* W and L are physical dimensions of the OFET device.
* μ is the hole mobility, which is a material property.
* C is the capacitance of the device.
* Vgs and Vth are voltages applied to the device.
* Ion and Ioff are currents flowing through the device in the on and off states, respectively.
* I is the current flowing through the device.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| μ | Mobility |
| C | Capacitance |
| Vgs | Gate-source voltage |
| Vth | Threshold voltage |

Note: The entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to the value of a material property are:

* μ (mobility)
* C (capacitance)
* Vgs (gate-source voltage)
* Vth (threshold voltage)

The other entities mentioned in the paragraph, such as W, L, Ion, and Ioff, do not clearly refer to the value of a material property and were therefore excluded from the table.
